item.title: UK Music
item.description: An accessibility focussed re-brand for one of the UK’s leading industry-funded bodies representing the interests of the British music industry.

item.title: Create code snippets in Sublime Text 3
item.description: Code snippets in Sublime Text 3 can save you a lot of time. They allow you to create a key word which you type and then press ‘tab’ to generate a code block.

item.title: Handy SVG Resources
item.description: This is a list of easy to copy and paste SVG’s that might be commonly used on projects. All SVG code will be clean, simple and easy to use. This list will be periodically updated.

item.title: The Ogden Trust
item.description: The Ogden Trust is a charitable organisation based in London which aims to increase the uptake of physics for all at post-16.

item.title: Interactive Google Map Tutorial: Multiple markers, marker toggles & Wordpress CMS integration
item.description: In this tutorial, I will walk through how to set up a map with multiple markers using the Google Maps API, make it editable in Wordpress using the Advanced Custom Fields repeater field and additionally to categorise groups of map markers so that they can be filtered using onclick buttons in Javascript.

item.title: Domino Printing
item.description: From late 2018 to present (January 2019), I was tasked with hand coding a number of email templates for Domino printing. These email templates ranged from standard marketing emails, to internal newsletters.

item.title: Oryx the Journal
item.description: From late 2018 to present (January 2019), I was tasked with hand coding a number of email templates for Domino printing. These email templates ranged from standard marketing emails, to internal newsletters.

item.title: Freman College
item.description: In March 2017, I was tasked with building the brand new Freman College website. Following on from other successful projects such as Lucy Cavendish College, I have found over the years that education based websites have been some of my favourite projects to work on.

item.title: The Woolf Institute
item.description: The Woolf Institute approached Chameleon for a brand new website which would launch in conjunction with their move to an impressive new premises on Madingley Road in Cambridge.

item.title: Create a Wordpress User role that only has access to a specific custom post type
item.description: There are already some default User Roles that can be used in Wordpress such as Editor, and Author. However, Custom User Roles can be useful to create in Wordpress if you want a finer level of control over the permissions.

item.title: Return an Option From a Select dropdown in Javascript
item.description: In this article, I will explore how you can use Javascript to return the clicked on ‘option’ from a select dropdown menu.

item.title: Building Space Invaders in Vanilla Javascript
item.description: A fun side project, where I create an ongoing journal log of my attempts to build the classic arcade game ‘Space Invaders’ from the ground up, with zero tutorials, using Javascript.

item.title: Creating Pardot Email Templates using MJML
item.description: Creating an email template that works across multiple email clients can be a notoriously difficult task. However, templating tools such as MJML can make things much easier, and combining MJML with Pardot is a robust workflow to create effective email marketing campaigns.

item.title: How to Create Pandoc Templates
item.description: Pandoc is a powerful tool that lets you convert one document type into another. It also has the ability to reference a template when converting multiple files.

item.title: How to bulk clone folders using rsync
item.description: One of the best features of a computer is the ability to automate tasks so that you don’t have to repeat the same task manually over and over. One such task you may face is copying files across multiple folders from one location to another.

item.title: Find & replace words using a Perl script
item.description: Are you looking for a quick, powerful way to find and replace a word across multiple documents? Writing a small Perl script is a simple and powerful method you could try.
